scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
pay, ala, tances, ble, sailor, talya, sie, flung, of, nine, an, offs, robe, bust, spierre, ca, pa, sis, re, ing, ro, fend

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — the final payment of a debt
B. (2 syllables) — Not greatly influenced by errors in assumptions about the distribution of sample errors.
C. (1 syllables) — To sink; fall; drop.
D. (3 syllables) — Responsible; to be blamed.
E. (2 syllables) — a port city in southwestern Turkey on the Gulf of [masked]
F. (2 syllables) — French revolutionary; leader of the Jacobins and architect of the Reign of Terror; was himself executed in a coup d'etat (1758-1794)
G. (3 syllables) — Of sufficient capacity or size for holding, containing, receiving or taking in; accessible to. Construed with ''of'', ''for'' or an infinitive.
H. (2 syllables) — A nonessential amino acid ''2-aminopropanoic acid'' found in most animal proteins
I. (1 syllables) — any member of a ship's crew
J. (3 syllables) — a material's opposition to the flow of electric current; measured in ohms

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 11 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
em, en, ble, rolled, terfuge, uni, u, tem, lar, ized, so, lock, li, plar, in, pop, rewrites, i, an, shad, tar, inem, ma, ac, ow, dead, yea, fling, si, ces

## Clues
A. (4 syllables) — A Christian who denies the doctrine of the Trinity, usually stressing some distinctions between God the Father and God the Son without denying the divinity of Jesus.
B. (3 syllables) — DOM: african
C. (2 syllables) — DOM: recording artist
D. (2 syllables) — a situation in which no progress can be made or no advancement is possible
E. (1 syllables) — Yes, indeed.
F. (2 syllables) — a knight of a religious military order established in 1118 to protect pilgrims and the Holy Sepulcher
G. (2 syllables) — register formally as a participant or member
H. (1 syllables) — A short romantic, oftentimes sexual, relationship.
I. (2 syllables) — DOM: localized spatial thing
J. (5 syllables) — An uncountable regular cardinal number that is a limit cardinal.
K. (4 syllables) — make understandable to the general public

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 12 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
rop, decades, toulouse, gripes, caf, fat, dms, ing, hu, lencer, man, heartache, fritz, ed, scream, fences, pied, ism, dames, drone, feine

## Clues

B. (1 syllables) — a metric unit of length equal to one tenth of a meter

Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
